Package GUI

Class GameSpirit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • GUI.GameSpirit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameSpirit
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    GameSpirit objects is a graphic representation of GameObjects and is basicly the UI. it extends JComponent for use inside a other swing elements.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameSpirit

        public GameSpirit​(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  java.awt.Image img)
        [Constructor]
        creates new GameSpirit.
        Parameters:
        x - - RAW X pixel position.
        y - - RAW Y pixel position.
        width - - width of the image.
        height - - height of the image.
        img - - the image.

      • GameSpirit

        public GameSpirit​(BasicGameSpirit obj,
                  Map map)
        [Constructor]
        Creates new GameSpirit object.
        Parameters:
        obj - BasicGameSpirit (can be GameObject)
        map - Map for coordinates conversion of Geodetic points of GameObject to Pixels XY.

      • GameSpirit

        public GameSpirit​(BasicGameSpirit obj,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        must have (x,y) pixel coordinates already processed position by a Map object.
        preferable way is to generate this object with the "Game" object with "createGameSpirit(GameObject obj)".
        Parameters:
        obj - GameObject

    • Method Detail

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation​(int x,
                           int y)
        Updating this GameSpirit location using "setLocation(x,y)", but updating GameSpirit's related properties to match MyFrame's scaling algorithm.
        use it for moving the component around.
        Parameters:
        x - position in pixels
        y - position in pixels

      • updateSize

        public void updateSize​(int width,
                       int height)
        Updating this GameSpirit size (width and height) using "setSize(w, h)", but updating GameSpirit's related properties to match MyFrame's scaling algorithm
        use it for resizing the component (as Game component size).
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -

      • moveByPixel

        public void moveByPixel​(int x,
                        int y)
        Moving the GameSpirit by x pixels horizontally and y pixels vertically (as right / down are positive and left / up are negative values)
        Parameters:
        x - amount of pixels to shift right >>
        y - amount of pixels to shift down

        y -
        width -
        height -
